definition: to manufacture charcoal/to burn charcoal (often a reference to suicide by carbon monoxide poisoning)
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head

sentences.english: Of all the ways to die， charcoal burning seems to be gaining in popularity in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 芸芸自殺方式中，燒炭在香港越來越流行。

sentences.english: 20 per cent of suicide victims died in 2001 from charcoal burning in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 二零零一年，本港百分之二十的自殺人士死於燒炭。

sentences.english: A couple was found dead near burned charcoal in a flat.
sentences.chinese: 一對情侶在一單位燒炭自殺身亡。

sentences.english: Catalyst regeneration is an unsteady state process.
sentences.chinese: 催化劑燒炭再生是非定態過程。

sentences.english: A CHARCOAL-BURNER carried on his trade in his own house.
sentences.chinese: 有一個燒炭工，在自己的家裏燒炭來賣。

sentences.english: A CHARCOAL-BURNER carried on his trade in his own house.
sentences.chinese: 有一個燒炭工，在自己的家裏燒炭來賣。

sentences.english: People are killing themselves by charcoal-burning in increasing numbers.
Through this trip, I know how to make charcoal.
sentences.chinese: 通過這次旅行，我知道如何燒炭了。

sentences.english: Hong Kong now had the world's highest charcoal-burning rate for those trying to commit suicide.
sentences.chinese: 香港是全球以燒炭方式自殺比率最高的地方。

definition: to ignite/to light a fire/to agitate/to start an engine/ignition/fig. to stir up trouble
fire and candles/household things that burn
to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
to discharge smoke/to fume with rage
a thousand pounds hangs by a thread (idiom)/imminent peril/a matter of life or death
to meet violent death/to get killed
